00083 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00084   * @brief  Main program.
00085   * @retval None
00086   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00087 int main(void)
00088 {
00089   RETARGET_Configuration();           /* Retarget Related configuration                                     */
00090 
00091   CKCU_Configuration();
00092   GPIO_Configuration();
00093 
00094   USB_Configuration();                /* USB Related configuration                                          */
00095 
00096   I2CM_Init();
00097   WM8978_Init();
00098 
00099   /* Config PDMA for I2S TX                                                                                 */
00100   PDMA_Configuration();
00101 
00102   /* Config I2S                                                                                             */
00103   I2S_Configuration();
00104 
00105   HT32F_DVB_USBConnect();
00106 
00107   while (1)
00108   {
00109     USBDCore_MainRoutine(&gUSBCore);  /* USB core main routine                                              */
00110     I2S_MainRoutine();
00111   }
00112 }

00114 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00115  * @brief  I2S Main Routine.
00116  * @retval None
00117  ************************************************************************************************************/
00118 void I2S_MainRoutine(void)
00119 {
00120   if (UAC_bMuteControl == 0x00)
00121   {
00122     I2S_TxMuteCmd(DISABLE);
00123   }
00124   else
00125   {
00126     I2S_TxMuteCmd(ENABLE);
00127   }
00128 }

00130 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00131   * @brief  Suspend call back function which enter DeepSleep1
00132   * @param  uPara: Parameter for Call back function
00133   * @retval None
00134   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00135 void Suspend(u32 uPara)
00136 {
00137   #if (REMOTE_WAKEUP == 1)
00138   u32 IsRemoteWakeupAllowed;
00139   #endif
00140 
00141   if (gIsLowPowerAllowed)
00142   {
00143 
00144     #if (REMOTE_WAKEUP == 1)
00145     /* Disable EXTI interrupt to prevent interrupt occurred after wakeup                                    */
00146     EXTI_IntConfig(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL, DISABLE);
00147     IsRemoteWakeupAllowed = USBDCore_GetRemoteWakeUpFeature(&gUSBCore);
00148 
00149     if (IsRemoteWakeupAllowed == TRUE)
00150     {
00151       /* Enable EXTI wake event and clear wakeup flag                                                       */
00152       EXTI_WakeupEventConfig(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL, EXTI_WAKEUP_LOW_LEVEL, ENABLE);
00153       EXTI_ClearWakeupFlag(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL);
00154     }
00155     #endif
00156 
00157     __DBG_USBPrintf("%06ld >DEEPSLEEP\r\n", ++__DBG_USBCount);
00158 
00159     // Add your procedure here which disable related IO to reduce power consumption
00160     // ..................
00161     //
00162 
00163     if ((gUSBCore.Info.CurrentStatus == USB_STATE_SUSPENDED) && ((HT_USB->CSR & 0xC0) == 0x40))   // D+ = 1, D- = 0
00164     {
00165       /* For Bus powered device, you must enter DeepSleep1 when device has been suspended. For self-powered */
00166       /* device, you may decide to enter DeepSleep1 or not depended on your application.                    */
00167 
00168       /* For the convenient during debugging and evaluation stage, the USBDCore_LowPower() is map to a null */
00169       /* function by default. In the real product, you must map this function to the low power function of  */
00170       /* firmware library by setting USBDCORE_ENABLE_LOW_POWER as 1 (in the ht32fxxxx_usbdconf.h file).     */
00171       USBDCore_LowPower();
00172     }
00173 
00174     // Add your procedure here which recovery related IO for application
00175     // ..................
00176     //
00177 
00178     __DBG_USBPrintf("%06ld <DEEPSLEEP\r\n", ++__DBG_USBCount);
00179 
00180     #if (REMOTE_WAKEUP == 1)
00181     if (EXTI_GetWakeupFlagStatus(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL) == SET)
00182     {
00183       __DBG_USBPrintf("%06ld WAKEUP\r\n", ++__DBG_USBCount);
00184       if (IsRemoteWakeupAllowed == TRUE && USBDCore_IsSuspend(&gUSBCore) == TRUE)
00185       {
00186         USBDCore_TriggerRemoteWakeup();
00187       }
00188     }
00189 
00190     if (IsRemoteWakeupAllowed == TRUE)
00191     {
00192       /* Disable EXTI wake event and clear wakeup flag                                                      */
00193       EXTI_WakeupEventConfig(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL, EXTI_WAKEUP_LOW_LEVEL, DISABLE);
00194       EXTI_ClearWakeupFlag(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL);
00195     }
00196 
00197     /* Clear EXTI edge flag and enable EXTI interrupt                                                       */
00198     EXTI_ClearEdgeFlag(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL);
00199     EXTI_IntConfig(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL, ENABLE);
00200     #endif
00201   }
00202 
00203   return;
00204 }

00216   CKCUClock.Bit.AFIO          = 1;
00217   CKCUClock.Bit.EXTI          = 1;
00218   CKCUClock.Bit.I2S           = 1;
00219   HTCFG_I2CM_CKCU(CKCUClock)  = 1;
00220   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00221 #endif
00222 }

00224 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00225   * @brief  Configure USART.
00226   * @retval None
00227   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00228 void GPIO_Configuration(void)
00229 {
00230   /* I2S                                                                                                    */
00231   AFIO_GPxConfig(HTCFG_I2S_BCLK_ID, HTCFG_I2S_BCLK_ADIO_PIN, AFIO_FUN_I2S);
00232   AFIO_GPxConfig(HTCFG_I2S_SDO_ID,  HTCFG_I2S_SDO_ADIO_PIN,  AFIO_FUN_I2S);
00233   AFIO_GPxConfig(HTCFG_I2S_SDI_ID,  HTCFG_I2S_SDI_ADIO_PIN,  AFIO_FUN_I2S);
00234   AFIO_GPxConfig(HTCFG_I2S_MCLK_ID, HTCFG_I2S_MCLK_ADIO_PIN, AFIO_FUN_I2S);
00235   AFIO_GPxConfig(HTCFG_I2S_WS_ID,   HTCFG_I2S_WS_ADIO_PIN,   AFIO_FUN_I2S);
00236 
00237   /* I2C                                                                                                    */
00238   AFIO_GPxConfig(HTCFG_I2CM_MASTER_SCK_ID, HTCFG_I2CM_MASTER_SCK_AFIO_PIN, AFIO_FUN_I2C);
00239   AFIO_GPxConfig(HTCFG_I2CM_MASTER_SDA_ID, HTCFG_I2CM_MASTER_SDA_AFIO_PIN, AFIO_FUN_I2C);
00240 }

00242 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00243   * @brief  Configure USB.
00244   * @retval None
00245   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00246 void USB_Configuration(void)
00247 {
00248   #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_USB_PLL)
00249   USBPLL_Configuration();
00250   #endif
00251 
00252   #if (LIBCFG_PWRCU_VREG)
00253   USBVRG_Configuration();                               /* Voltage of USB setting                           */
00254   #endif
00255 
00256   gUSBCore.pDriver = (u32 *)&gUSBDriver;                /* Initiate memory pointer of USB driver            */
00257   gUSBCore.Power.CallBack_Suspend.func  = Suspend;      /* Install suspend call back function into USB core */
00258   //gUSBCore.Power.CallBack_Suspend.uPara = (u32)NULL;
00259 
00260   USBDDesc_Init(&gUSBCore.Device.Desc);                 /* Initiate memory pointer of descriptor            */
00261   USBDClass_Init(&gUSBCore.Class);                      /* Initiate USB Class layer                         */
00262   USBDCore_Init(&gUSBCore);                             /* Initiate USB Core layer                          */
00263 
00264   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00265      Must turn on if the USB clock source is from HSI (PLL clock Source)
00266   */
00267   #if 0
00268   { /* Turn on HSI auto trim function                                                                       */
00269     CKCU_HSIAutoTrimClkConfig(CKCU_ATC_USB);
00270     CKCU_HSIAutoTrimCmd(ENABLE);
00271   }
00272   #endif
00273 
00274   NVIC_EnableIRQ(USB_IRQn);                             /* Enable USB device interrupt                      */
00275 }

00277 #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_USB_PLL)
00278 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00279  * @brief  Configure USB PLL
00280  * @retval None
00281  ************************************************************************************************************/
00282 void USBPLL_Configuration(void)
00283 {
00284   { /* USB PLL configuration                                                                                */
00285 
00286     /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00287        Notice that the local variable (structure) did not have an initial value.
00288        Please confirm that there are no missing members in the parameter settings below in this function.
00289     */
00290     CKCU_PLLInitTypeDef PLLInit;
00291 
00292     PLLInit.ClockSource = CKCU_PLLSRC_HSE;  // CKCU_PLLSRC_HSE or CKCU_PLLSRC_HSI
00293     #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_USB_PLL_96M)
00294     PLLInit.CFG = CKCU_USBPLL_8M_96M;
00295     #else
00296     PLLInit.CFG = CKCU_USBPLL_8M_48M;
00297     #endif
00298     PLLInit.BYPASSCmd = DISABLE;
00299     CKCU_USBPLLInit(&PLLInit);
00300   }
00301 
00302   CKCU_USBPLLCmd(ENABLE);
00303 
00304   while (CKCU_GetClockReadyStatus(CKCU_FLAG_USBPLLRDY) == RESET);
00305   CKCU_USBClockConfig(CKCU_CKUSBPLL);
00306 }
00307 #endif

00309 #if (LIBCFG_PWRCU_VREG)
00310 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00311  * @brief  Configure USB Voltage
00312  * @retval None
00313  ************************************************************************************************************/
00314 void USBVRG_Configuration(void)
00315 {
00316   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{ 0 }};
00317   CKCUClock.Bit.BKP                   = 1;
00318   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00319 
00320   PWRCU_SetVREG(PWRCU_VREG_3V3);
00321 
00322   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00323      USB LDO should be enabled (PWRCU_VREG_ENABLE) if the MCU VDD > 3.6 V.
00324   */
00325   PWRCU_VREGConfig(PWRCU_VREG_BYPASS);
00326 }

00329 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00330   * @brief  Configure the I2S.
00331   * @retval None
00332   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00333 void I2S_Configuration(void)
00334 {
00335   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00336      Notice that the local variable (structure) did not have an initial value.
00337      Please confirm that there are no missing members in the parameter settings below in this function.
00338   */
00339   I2S_InitTypeDef I2S_InitStructure;
00340   I2S_InitStructure.I2S_Mode = I2S_MASTER_TX_RX;
00341   I2S_InitStructure.I2S_Format = I2S_JUSTIFIED_STEREO;
00342   I2S_InitStructure.I2S_WordWidth = I2S_WORDWIDTH_16;
00343   I2S_InitStructure.I2S_MclkOut = ENABLE;
00344   I2S_InitStructure.I2S_MclkInv = DISABLE;
00345   I2S_InitStructure.I2S_BclkInv = DISABLE;
00346   I2S_InitStructure.I2S_X_Div = HTCFG_I2S_X_DIV;                // MCLK = (PCLK * X_DIV / Y_DIV) / 2 = about 12.288 MHz (256 x 48 kHz, WM8978 required the MCLK = 256 fs)
00347   I2S_InitStructure.I2S_Y_Div = HTCFG_I2S_Y_DIV;
00348   I2S_InitStructure.I2S_N_Div = 256 / (2 * 16) - 1;             // BCLK = MCLK / 8 = about 1536 kHz (32 x 48 kHz, 2 CH x 16-bit = 32 fs)
00349   I2S_Init(&I2S_InitStructure);
00350 
00351   I2S_FIFOTrigLevelConfig(I2S_TX_FIFO, 4);  // Tx FIFO data '<' or '=' 3
00352   I2S_PDMACmd(I2S_PDMAREQ_TX, ENABLE);
00353 
00354   I2S_IntConfig(I2S_INT_TXFIFO_UDF, ENABLE);
00355   NVIC_EnableIRQ(I2S_IRQn);
00356 
00357   I2S_Cmd(ENABLE);
00358 }
00359 
00360 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00361   * @brief  Configure the PDMA.
00362   * @retval None
00363   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00364 void PDMA_Configuration(void)
00365 {
00366   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00367      Notice that the local variable (structure) did not have an initial value.
00368      Please confirm that there are no missing members in the parameter settings below in this function.
00369   */
00370   PDMACH_InitTypeDef PDMACH_InitStructure;
00371   PDMACH_InitStructure.PDMACH_SrcAddr = (u32)&TxBuf[0][0];
00372   PDMACH_InitStructure.PDMACH_DstAddr = (u32)&HT_I2S->TXDR;
00373   PDMACH_InitStructure.PDMACH_AdrMod = (SRC_ADR_LIN_INC | DST_ADR_FIX | AUTO_RELOAD);
00374   PDMACH_InitStructure.PDMACH_BlkCnt = BUF_SIZE / 4;
00375   PDMACH_InitStructure.PDMACH_BlkLen = 4;
00376   PDMACH_InitStructure.PDMACH_DataSize = WIDTH_32BIT;
00377   PDMACH_InitStructure.PDMACH_Priority = M_PRIO;
00378   PDMA_Config(PDMA_CH2, &PDMACH_InitStructure);
00379 
00380   PDMA_IntConfig(PDMA_CH2, (PDMA_INT_GE | PDMA_INT_TC | PDMA_INT_HT), ENABLE);
00381   NVIC_EnableIRQ(PDMACH2_5_IRQn);
00382 
00383   PDMA_EnaCmd(PDMA_CH2, ENABLE);
00384 }

00386 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00387  * @brief   This function is used to init the I2C master.
00388  * @retval  None
00389  ************************************************************************************************************/
00390 void I2CM_Init(void)
00391 {
00392   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00393      Notice that the local variable (structure) did not have an initial value.
00394      Please confirm that there are no missing members in the parameter settings below in this function.
00395   */
00396   I2C_InitTypeDef  I2C_InitStructure;
00397 
00398   /* I2C configuration                                                                                      */
00399   I2C_InitStructure.I2C_GeneralCall     = I2C_GENERALCALL_DISABLE;
00400   I2C_InitStructure.I2C_AddressingMode  = I2C_ADDRESSING_7BIT;
00401   I2C_InitStructure.I2C_Acknowledge     = I2C_ACK_DISABLE;
00402   I2C_InitStructure.I2C_OwnAddress      = I2CM_OWN_ADDR;
00403   I2C_InitStructure.I2C_Speed           = I2CM_SPEED;
00404   I2C_InitStructure.I2C_SpeedOffset     = 0;
00405   I2C_Init(HTCFG_I2CM_ID, &I2C_InitStructure);
00406 
00407   I2C_SetTimeOutPrescaler(HTCFG_I2CM_ID, I2C_PRESCALER_128);
00408   I2C_SetTimeOutValue(HTCFG_I2CM_ID, ((SystemCoreClock/128) * 8 * 10) / I2CM_SPEED); /* Must within 10 Bytes Time    */
00409 
00410   /* Enable I2C                                                                                             */
00411   I2C_Cmd(HTCFG_I2CM_ID, ENABLE);
00412   I2C_TimeOutCmd(HTCFG_I2CM_ID, ENABLE);
00413 
00414   /* Enable I2C interrupts                                                                                  */
00415   I2C_IntConfig(HTCFG_I2CM_ID, I2C_INT_STA | I2C_INT_ADRS | I2C_INT_RXDNE | I2C_INT_TXDE |\
00416                       I2C_INT_RXNACK | I2C_INT_TOUT | I2C_INT_BUSERR | I2C_INT_ARBLOS, ENABLE);
00417   NVIC_EnableIRQ(HTCFG_I2CM_IRQ);
00418 }
00419 
00420 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00421  * @brief   Set the word address mode used 8 bits or 16 bits.
00422  * @param   word_addr_mode: Specify addressing mode. This parameter can be one of the following values:

00425  * @retval  none
00426  ************************************************************************************************************/
00427 void I2CM_WordAddressModeConfig(u32 word_addr_mode)
00428 {
00429   I2CM_Transfer.RegAddrMode = word_addr_mode;
00430 }

00437 void I2CM_InstallTransferEndCallback(void (*callback)(void))

00448   I2CM_Transfer.TransferEndCallback = NULL;
00449 }

00451 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00452  * @brief   Get the I2C master transfer status.
00453  * @retval  SUCCESS or ERROR
00454  ************************************************************************************************************/
00455 u32 I2CM_GetTransferStatus(void)
00456 {
00457   u32 return_value = I2CM_BUSY;
00458   I2CM_TransferType* pTransfer = &I2CM_Transfer;
00459 
00460   if (pTransfer->Status != I2CM_BUSY)
00461   {
00462     u32 timeout = 500; /* 50 mS                                                                             */
00463     while (I2C_GetFlagStatus(HTCFG_I2CM_ID, I2C_FLAG_BUSBUSY))
00464     {
00465       I2CM_DelayXuS(100);
00466       timeout--;
00467       if (timeout == 0)
00468       {
00469         pTransfer->Status = I2CM_TOUTF;
00470         I2C_GenerateSTOP(HTCFG_I2CM_ID);
00471         I2CM_DelayXuS(1000);
00472         I2C_DeInit(HTCFG_I2CM_ID);
00473         break;
00474       }
00475     }
00476     return_value = pTransfer->Status;
00477   }
00478 
00479   return return_value;
00480 }
00481 
00482 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00483  * @brief   Waits until the transfer is completed.
00484  * @retval  SUCCESS or ERROR
00485  ************************************************************************************************************/
00486 ErrStatus I2CM_WaitTransferEnd(void)
00487 {
00488   ErrStatus retv = ERROR;
00489 
00490   while (1)
00491   {
00492     u32 status = I2CM_GetTransferStatus();
00493     if (status != I2CM_BUSY)
00494     {
00495       if (status == I2CM_OK)
00496       {
00497         retv = SUCCESS;
00498       }
00499       else
00500       {
00501         I2CM_DBG_PRINTF("\r\nI2CM Error state 0x%X at line %u\r\n", status, __LINE__);
00502       }
00503       break;
00504     }
00505   }
00506 
00507   return retv;
00508 }
00509 
00510 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00511  * @brief   Read data from I2C.
00512  * @param   dev: Specify the target I2C device address.
00513  * @param   word_addr: Specify the word address of target I2C device.
00514  * @param   data: Specify pointer that point to the receive buffer.
00515  * @param   count: Specify the read data length.
00516  * @retval  None
00517  ************************************************************************************************************/
00518 void I2CM_BufferRead(u16 dev, u16 word_addr, u8* data, u16 count)
00519 {
00520   I2CM_TransferType* pTransfer = &I2CM_Transfer;
00521 
00522   while (I2CM_GetTransferStatus() == I2CM_BUSY);
00523 
00524   pTransfer->RegAddr     = word_addr;
00525   pTransfer->Buffer      = data;
00526   pTransfer->Length      = count;
00527   pTransfer->Counter     = 0;
00528   pTransfer->Direction   = I2CM_DIRECTION_IN;
00529   pTransfer->DevAddr     = dev;
00530   pTransfer->Status      = I2CM_BUSY;
00531   pTransfer->RetryDownCounter = I2CM_BUS_MAX_RETRY;
00532 
00533   /* Send I2C START                                                                                         */
00534   I2C_TargetAddressConfig(HTCFG_I2CM_ID, pTransfer->DevAddr, I2C_MASTER_WRITE);
00535 }
00536 
00537 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00538  * @brief   Blocked Read data from I2C.
00539  * @param   dev: Specify the target I2C device address.
00540  * @param   word_addr: Specify the word address of target I2C device.
00541  * @param   data: Specify pointer that point to the receiver buffer.
00542  * @param   count: Specify the read data length.
00543  * @retval  SUCCESS or ERROR
00544  ************************************************************************************************************/
00545 ErrStatus I2CM_BlockedBufferRead(u16 dev, u16 word_addr, u8* data, u16 count)
00546 {
00547   I2CM_BufferRead(dev, word_addr, data, count);
00548   return I2CM_WaitTransferEnd();
00549 }
00550 
00551 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00552  * @brief   Write data to I2C.
00553  * @param   dev: Specify the target I2C device address.
00554  * @param   word_addr: Specify the word address of target I2C device.
00555  * @param   data: Specify pointer that point to the transmitter buffer.
00556  * @param   count: Specify the write data length.
00557  * @retval  None
00558  ************************************************************************************************************/
00559 void I2CM_BufferWrite(u16 dev, u16 word_addr, u8* data, u16 count)
00560 {
00561   I2CM_TransferType* pTransfer = &I2CM_Transfer;
00562 
00563   while (I2CM_GetTransferStatus() == I2CM_BUSY);
00564 
00565   pTransfer->RegAddr     = word_addr;
00566   pTransfer->Buffer      = data;
00567   pTransfer->Length      = count;
00568   pTransfer->Counter     = 0;
00569   pTransfer->Direction   = I2CM_DIRECTION_OUT;
00570   pTransfer->DevAddr     = dev;
00571   pTransfer->Status      = I2CM_BUSY;
00572   pTransfer->RetryDownCounter = I2CM_BUS_MAX_RETRY;
00573 
00574   /* Send I2C START                                                                                         */
00575   I2C_TargetAddressConfig(HTCFG_I2CM_ID, pTransfer->DevAddr, I2C_MASTER_WRITE);
00576 
00577 }
00578 
00579 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00580  * @brief   Blocked write data to I2C.
00581  * @param   dev: Specify the target I2C device address.
00582  * @param   word_addr: Specify the word address of target I2C device.
00583  * @param   data: Specify pointer that point to the transmitter buffer.
00584  * @param   count: Specify the write data length.
00585  * @retval  SUCCESS or ERROR
00586  ************************************************************************************************************/
00587 ErrStatus I2CM_BlockedBufferWrite(u16 dev, u16 word_addr, u8* data, u16 count)
00588 {
00589   I2CM_BufferWrite(dev, word_addr, data, count);
00590   return I2CM_WaitTransferEnd();
00591 }
00592 
00593 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00594  * @brief  WM8978 register read
00595  * @retval None
00596  ************************************************************************************************************/
00597 void WM8978_RegWrite(u16 Address, u16 Data)
00598 {
00599   Address = (Address | Data) >> 8;
00600   I2CM_BlockedBufferWrite(WM8978_ID, Address, (u8*)&Data, 1);
00601 }
00602 
00603 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00604  * @brief  Init WM8978.
00605  * @retval None
00606  ************************************************************************************************************/
00607 void WM8978_Init(void)
00608 {
00609   /********************************************
00610    * Power On Sequence
00611    ********************************************/
00612   /* REG_00                                                                                                 */
00613   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_SOFTWARE_RESET, 0);
00614   /* REG_34 (Headphone)                                                                                     */
00615   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_LOUT1_VOL, LOUT1MUTE);
00616   /* REG_35 (Headphone)                                                                                     */
00617   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_ROUT1_VOL, ROUT1MUTE);
00618   /* REG_36 (SPK)                                                                                           */
00619   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_LOUT2_VOL, LOUT2MUTE);
00620   /* REG_37 (SPK)                                                                                           */
00621   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_ROUT2_VOL, ROUT2MUTE);
00622   /* REG_38                                                                                                 */
00623   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_OUT3_MIXER, OUT3MUTE);
00624   /* REG_39                                                                                                 */
00625   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_OUT4_MIXER, OUT4MUTE);
00626   /* REG_01                                                                                                 */
00627   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_POWER_MANAGEMENT1, BUFDCOPEN | BUFIOEN | VMIDSEL_75K | BIASEN | MICBEN);
00628   /* REG_31                                                                                                 */
00629   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_OUTPUT, SPKBOOST);
00630   /* REG_03                                                                                                 */
00631   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_POWER_MANAGEMENT3, LMIXEN | DACENL | RMIXEN | DACENR | LOUT2EN | ROUT2EN);
00632   /* REG_02                                                                                                 */
00633   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_POWER_MANAGEMENT2, LOUT1EN | ROUT1EN | INPPGAENL | INPPGAENR | ADCENL | ADCENR);
00634 
00635   /********************************************
00636    * Digital Audio Interfaces
00637    ********************************************/
00638   /* REG_04                                                                                                 */
00639   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_AUDIO_INTERFACE, /*FMT_I2S FMT_RIGHT_JUSTIFIED*/ FMT_I2S | WL_16BITS);
00640   /* REG_06                                                                                                 */
00641   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_CLOCK_GEN, CLKSEL_MCLK | MCLK_DIV1);
00642 
00643   /********************************************
00644    * Analogue Sample Rates & Analogue Outputs
00645    ********************************************/
00646   /* REG_07                                                                                                 */
00647 #if (SOURCE_TYPE_SEL == SOURCE_TYPE_VOICE)
00648   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_ADDITIONAL, SR_8KHZ);
00649 #else
00650   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_ADDITIONAL, SR_48KHZ);
00651 #endif
00652   /********************************************
00653    * GPIO
00654    ********************************************/
00655   /* REG_08                                                                                                 */
00656   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_GPIO, 0);
00657 
00658   /********************************************
00659    * Output Switching
00660    ********************************************/
00661   /* REG_09                                                                                                 */
00662   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_JACK_DETECT1, 0);
00663 
00664   /********************************************
00665    * Output Signal Path & Power Management
00666    ********************************************/
00667   /* REG_0A                                                                                                 */
00668   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_DAC, 0);
00669 
00670   /********************************************
00671    * Analogue to Digital Converter
00672    ********************************************/
00673   /* REG_0B                                                                                                 */
00674   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_LEFT_DAC_VOL, DACVU | 0xFF);  /* 0xFF = 0dB, 0xFE = -0.5dB, 0xFD = -1dB, ...          */
00675 
00676   /********************************************
00677    * Output Signal Path
00678    ********************************************/
00679   /* REG_0C                                                                                                 */
00680   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_RIGHT_DAC_VOL, DACVU | 0xFF); /* 0xFF = 0dB, 0xFE = -0.5dB, 0xFD = -1dB, ...          */
00681 
00682   /********************************************
00683    * Output Switching
00684    ********************************************/
00685   /* REG_0D                                                                                                 */
00686   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_JACK_DETECT2, 0);
00687 
00688   /********************************************
00689    * Analogue to Digital Converter
00690    ********************************************/
00691   /* REG_0E                                                                                                 */
00692   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_ADC, HPFEN | HPFAPP | HPFCUT_0 | ADCOSR128);
00693   /* REG_0F                                                                                                 */
00694   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_LEFT_ADC_VOL, ADCVU | 0xFF);  /* 0xFF = 0dB, 0xFE = -0.5dB, 0xFD = -1dB, ...          */
00695   /* REG_10                                                                                                 */
00696   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_RIGHT_ADC_VOL, ADCVU | 0xFF); /* 0xFF = 0dB, 0xFE = -0.5dB, 0xFD = -1dB, ...          */
00697 
00698   /********************************************
00699    * Output Signal Path
00700    ********************************************/
00701   /* REG_12                                                                                                 */
00702   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_EQ1, EQ3DMODE_DAC | EQ1C_80HZ | 0x0C);
00703   /* REG_13                                                                                                 */
00704   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_EQ2, EQ2BW_NARROW | EQ2C_230HZ | 0x0C);
00705   /* REG_14                                                                                                 */
00706   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_EQ3, EQ3BW_NARROW | EQ3C_650HZ | 0x0C);
00707   /* REG_15                                                                                                 */
00708   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_EQ4, EQ4BW_NARROW | EQ4C_1_8KHZ | 0x0C);
00709   /* REG_16                                                                                                 */
00710   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_EQ5, EQ5C_5_3KHZ | 0x0C);
00711   /* REG_18                                                                                                 */
00712   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_DAC_LIMITER1, LIMDCY_750US | LIMATK_94US);
00713   /* REG_19                                                                                                 */
00714   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_DAC_LIMITER2, LIMLVL_N1DB | LIMBOOST_0DB);
00715 
00716   /********************************************
00717    * Analogue to Digital Converter
00718    ********************************************/
00719   /* REG_1B                                                                                                 */
00720   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_NOTCH_FILTER1, 0);
00721   /* REG_1C                                                                                                 */
00722   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_NOTCH_FILTER2, 0);
00723   /* REG_1D                                                                                                 */
00724   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_NOTCH_FILTER3, 0);
00725   /* REG_1E                                                                                                 */
00726   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_NOTCH_FILTER4, 0);
00727 
00728   /********************************************
00729    * Input Limiter Automatic Level Control
00730    ********************************************/
00731   /* REG_20                                                                                                 */
00732   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_ALC1, ALCSEL_BOTH_ON | ALCMAXGAIN_35_25DB | ALCMINGAIN_N12DB);
00733   /* REG_21                                                                                                 */
00734   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_ALC2, ALCHLD_0MS | ALCLVL_N12DBFS);
00735   /* REG_22                                                                                                 */
00736 #if (SOURCE_TYPE_SEL == SOURCE_TYPE_VOICE)
00737   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_ALC3, ALCMODE_ALC | ALCDCY_3 | ALCATK_2);   // 8 kHz
00738 #else
00739   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_ALC3, ALCMODE_ALC | ALCDCY_10 | ALCATK_6);  // 44.1 kHz
00740 #endif
00741   /* REG_23                                                                                                 */
00742   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_NOISE_GATE, NGEN | NGTH_N75DB);
00743 
00744   /********************************************
00745    * Analogue Outputs
00746    ********************************************/
00747   /* REG_2B                                                                                                 */
00748   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_BEEP, INVROUT2);
00749 
00750   /********************************************
00751    * Input Signal Path
00752    ********************************************/
00753   /* REG_2C                                                                                                 */
00754   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_INPUT, MBVSEL_0_65AVDD | RIN2INPVGA | RIP2INPVGA | LIN2INPVGA | LIP2INPVGA);
00755   /* REG_2D                                                                                                 */
00756   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_LEFT_PGA_GAIN, INPPGAUPDATE | 0x10);
00757   /* REG_2E                                                                                                 */
00758   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_RIGHT_PGA_GAIN, INPPGAUPDATE | 0x10);
00759   /* REG_2F                                                                                                 */
00760   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_LEFT_ADC_BOOST, /* PGABOOSTL | */ L2_2BOOSTVOL_DISABLED | AUXL2BOOSTVOL_DISABLED);
00761   /* REG_30                                                                                                 */
00762   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_RIGHT_ADC_BOOST, /* PGABOOSTR | */ R2_2BOOSTVOL_DISABLED | AUXR2BOOSTVOL_DISABLED);
00763 
00764   /********************************************
00765    * Analogue Output
00766    ********************************************/
00767   /* REG_31                                                                                                 */
00768   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_OUTPUT, TSDEN | SPKBOOST);
00769   /* REG_32                                                                                                 */
00770   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_LEFT_MIXER, /* BYPLMIXVOL_6DB | BYPL2LMIX */ DACL2LMIX);
00771   /* REG_33                                                                                                 */
00772   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_RIGHT_MIXER, /* BYPRMIXVOL_6DB | BYPR2RMIX */ DACR2RMIX);
00773   /* REG_34                                                                                                 */
00774   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_LOUT1_VOL, HPVU | (0x39 + 0));    // +0 dB range from -57dB to +6dB
00775   /* REG_35                                                                                                 */
00776   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_ROUT1_VOL, HPVU | (0x39 + 0));    // +0 dB range from -57dB to +6dB
00777   /* REG_36                                                                                                 */
00778   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_LOUT2_VOL, SPKVU | (0x39 + 0));    // +0 dB range from -57dB to +6dB
00779   /* REG_37                                                                                                 */
00780   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_ROUT2_VOL, SPKVU | (0x39 + 0));    // +0 dB range from -57dB to +6dB
00781   /* REG_38                                                                                                 */
00782   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_OUT3_MIXER, OUT3MUTE);
00783   /* REG_39                                                                                                 */
00784   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_OUT4_MIXER, OUT4MUTE);
00785 }
00786 
00787 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00788   * @brief  DelayXuS.
00789   * @param  uS: Delay us
00790   * @retval None
00791   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00792 void DelayXuS(u32 uS)
00793 {
00794   uS *= 20;
00795   while (uS--);
00796 }

00798 #if (HT32_LIB_DEBUG == 1)
00799 /*********************************************************************************************************//**

00801   * @param  filename: pointer to the source file name.
00802   * @param  uline: error line source number.
00803   * @retval None
00804   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00805 void assert_error(u8* filename, u32 uline)
00806 {
00807   /*
00808      This function is called by IP library that the invalid parameters has been passed to the library API.
00809      Debug message can be added here.
00810      Example: printf("Parameter Error: file %s on line %d\r\n", filename, uline);
00811   */
00812 
00813   while (1)
00814   {
00815   }
00816 }
00817 #endif
